section.name: The command line
section.p: The only user interface of Eoulsan is the command line. The syntax and the available options can be get using the following command :
The program show you the following output:
section.source: usage: eoulsan [options] command arguments -about display information about this software -conf <file> configuration file to use -h,--help display this help -license display information about the license of this software -log <file> external log file -loglevel <level> log level -version show version of the software Available commands: - awsexec execute eoulsan on Amazon cloud. - createdesign create a design file from a list of files. - createhadoopjar create a jar file for hadoop with all dependencies include. - exec execute Eoulsan in local mode. - hadoopexec execute Eoulsan on local hadoop cluster.

ul.li: awsexec: Upload data and launch Eoulsan analysis on Amazon Web Services cloud.
exec: Launch Eoulsan analysis in local mode.
hadoopexec: Launch Eoulsan analysis in a Hadoop cluster.
createdesign: Create a design file from a list of fastq, gff and fasta files.
createhadoopjar: Create an Eoulsan jar file that contains all jar dependencies. This jar file can be used to run manualy Eoulsan on a Hadoop cluster (local or in Amazon Web Services cloud).

section.p: You can display general help and specific help about a command using -h argument.

subsection.name: -conf <file>
subsection.p: With this option, Eoulsan will load the file as configuration file. See the configuration section for more information.

subsection.name: -license
subsection.p: When you run Eoulsan with this option, you will get information about Eoulsan license and and then returns to the shell.

subsection.name: -loglevel <level>
subsection.p: Set the log level, there are 4 log level define in Eoulsan : Severe, Warning, Info and Fine. By default the log level is set to Info

subsection.name: -silent
subsection.p: Don't show log on the console.

subsection.name: -threads
subsection.p: Set the number of threads to use use when compute design. By default the value is set to the number of available processor (cores in multi-cores processor). If the value is lower than 1, use the default value.

subsection.name: -v
subsection.p: When this option is enable, the output of external tools used by Eoulsan will be displayed on the console.

subsection.name: -version
subsection.p: When you run Eoulsan with this option, you will get information about Eoulsan version and and then returns to the shell.
